full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 759 Filed 08/10/22 Page 96 of 267 2124 LCACmax3 A. Farmer - cross the government can propose any redactions. (Defendant's Exhibit AF1 received in evidence) BY MS. MENNINGER: Q. Thank you. This page 2 is actually is an entry that you made before you went to New York; right? A. Right. Q. And it doesn't have a date on it? A. Right. Q. But you're describing your excitement at going to see your sister in New York; right? A. Yeah. Q. And you're describing your excitement about meeting Epstein; correct? A. Right. Maria, I'm excited about getting this ticket that he bought me, yeah. Q. And you refer to him -- MS. MENNINGER: Could we publish to the jury that page. Is that a problem? MS. POMERANTZ: No, not at all. MS. MENNINGER: If we could publish to the jury that page, your Honor? THE COURT: Do you have it on paper? MS. MENNINGER: I don't think that the government thinks that there is any proposed redactions to this page. THE COURT: Let's just give them a minute. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00013687
